sub_topic: Calculation of standard enthalpy change for a phase transition reaction
message_1: Calculate the standard enthalpy change for the liquid-to-gas phase transition of water at 100°C and atmospheric pressure, given that the enthalpy of vaporization of water is 40.7 kJ/mol.
message_2:
The standard enthalpy change for the liquid-to-gas phase transition of water at 100°C and atmospheric pressure is simply the enthalpy of vaporization of water, which is given as 40.7 kJ/mol. 

So, the standard enthalpy change for this phase transition is 40.7 kJ/mol.
